trans-unit.source: The final stage of this tutorial is to build and run your new app.
trans-unit.target: The final stage of this tutorial is to build and run your new app.

trans-unit.source: Load project into Android Studio and sync Gradle
trans-unit.target: Load project into Android Studio and sync Gradle

trans-unit.source: Browse to the location where you saved the compressed project files and expand the files on your computer into your Android Studio projects directory.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the location where you saved the compressed project files and expand the files on your computer into your Android Studio projects directory.

trans-unit.source: Open Android Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open Android Studio.

trans-unit.source: If you are working with a project and it appears, close the project (File => Close Project).
trans-unit.target: If you are working with a project and it appears, close the project (File => Close Project).

trans-unit.source: Select **Open an existing Android Studio project**, browse to the project location, and then click **OK.**
trans-unit.target: Select **Open an existing Android Studio project**, browse to the project location, and then click **OK.**

trans-unit.source: This will load the project and start to sync it with Gradle.
trans-unit.target: This will load the project and start to sync it with Gradle.

trans-unit.source: Wait for the Gradle sync activity to complete.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the Gradle sync activity to complete.

trans-unit.source: If you see a "failed to find target" error, this is because the version used in Android Studio doesn't match that of the sample.
trans-unit.target: If you see a "failed to find target" error, this is because the version used in Android Studio doesn't match that of the sample.

trans-unit.source: The easiest way to fix this is to click the **Install missing platform(s) and sync project** link in the error message.
trans-unit.target: The easiest way to fix this is to click the **Install missing platform(s) and sync project** link in the error message.

trans-unit.source: You might get additional version error messages, and you simply repeat this process until no errors appear.
trans-unit.target: You might get additional version error messages, and you simply repeat this process until no errors appear.

trans-unit.source: There is another way to fix this if you want to run with the "latest and greatest" version of Android.
trans-unit.target: There is another way to fix this if you want to run with the "latest and greatest" version of Android.

trans-unit.source: You can update the **targetSdkVersion** in the *build.gradle* file in the *app* directory to match the version already installed on your machine, which you can discover by clicking the **SDK Manager** icon and seeing what version is listed.
trans-unit.target: You can update the **targetSdkVersion** in the *build.gradle* file in the *app* directory to match the version already installed on your machine, which you can discover by clicking the **SDK Manager** icon and seeing what version is listed.

trans-unit.source: Next you press the **Sync Project with Gradle Files**.
trans-unit.target: Next you press the **Sync Project with Gradle Files**.

trans-unit.source: You may get an error message for the version of Build Tools, and you fix that the same way.
trans-unit.target: You may get an error message for the version of Build Tools, and you fix that the same way.

trans-unit.source: Running the app
trans-unit.target: Running the app

trans-unit.source: You can run the app using the emulator, or using an actual device.
trans-unit.target: You can run the app using the emulator, or using an actual device.

trans-unit.source: To run from a device, connect it to your computer with a USB cable.
trans-unit.target: To run from a device, connect it to your computer with a USB cable.

trans-unit.source: You must [set up the device for development](https://developer.android.com/training/basics/firstapp/running-app.html).
trans-unit.target: You must [set up the device for development](https://developer.android.com/training/basics/firstapp/running-app.html).

trans-unit.source: If you are developing on a Windows machine, you must also download and install a USB driver.
trans-unit.target: If you are developing on a Windows machine, you must also download and install a USB driver.

trans-unit.source: To run using the Android emulator, you must define at least one Android Virtual Device (AVD).
trans-unit.target: To run using the Android emulator, you must define at least one Android Virtual Device (AVD).

trans-unit.source: Click the AVD Manager icon to create and manage these devices.
trans-unit.target: Click the AVD Manager icon to create and manage these devices.

trans-unit.source: From the **Run** menu, click **Run** to start the project.
trans-unit.target: From the **Run** menu, click **Run** to start the project.

trans-unit.source: and choose a device or emulator from the dialog box that appears.
trans-unit.target: and choose a device or emulator from the dialog box that appears.

trans-unit.source: When the app appears, type meaningful text, such as _Complete the tutorial_, and then click **Add**.
trans-unit.target: When the app appears, type meaningful text, such as _Complete the tutorial_, and then click **Add**.

trans-unit.source: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the list.
trans-unit.target: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the list.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the ToDoActivity.java file.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the ToDoActivity.java file.

trans-unit.source: Back in the Azure classic portal, click the **Data** tab and then click the **TodoItems** table.
trans-unit.target: Back in the Azure classic portal, click the **Data** tab and then click the **TodoItems** table.

trans-unit.source: This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.
trans-unit.target: This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.
